verses.verse: If there be a <S%H7379>controversy<s%> between <S%H582>men<s%>, and they <S%H5066>come<s%> unto <S%H4941>judgment<s%>, that the judges may <S%H8199>judge<s%> them; then they shall <S%H6663>justify<s%> the <S%H6662>righteous<s%>, and <S%H7561>condemn<s%> the <S%H7563>wicked<s%>.

And it shall be, if the wicked <S%H7563>man<s%> be <S%H1121>worthy<s%> to be <S%H5221>beaten<s%>, that the <S%H8199>judge<s%> shall cause him to lie <S%H5307>down<s%>, and to be <S%H5221>beaten<s%> before his <S%H6440>face<s%>, <S%H1767>according<s%> to his <S%H7564>fault<s%>, by a certain <S%H4557>number<s%>.

<S%H705>Forty<s%> <S%H5221>stripes<s%> he may give him, and not <S%H3254>exceed<s%>: lest, if he should <S%H3254>exceed<s%>, and <S%H5221>beat<s%> him above these with <S%H7227>many<s%> <S%H4347>stripes<s%>, then thy <S%H251>brother<s%> should seem <S%H7034%H5869>vile<s%> unto thee.
¶ Thou shalt not <S%H2629>muzzle<s%> the <S%H7794>ox<s%> when he treadeth <S%H1778>out<s%> the corn.

¶ If <S%H251>brethren<s%> <S%H3427>dwell<s%> <S%H3162>together<s%>, and <S%H259>one<s%> of them <S%H4191>die<s%>, and have no <S%H1121>child<s%>, the <S%H802>wife<s%> of the <S%H4191>dead<s%> shall not marry <S%H2351>without<s%> unto a <S%H376%H2114>stranger<s%>: her husband's <S%H2993>brother<s%> shall go <S%H935>in<s%> unto her, and <S%H3947>take<s%> her to him to <S%H802>wife<s%>, and perform the duty of an husband's <S%H2992>brother<s%> unto her.

And it shall be, that the <S%H1060>firstborn<s%> which she <S%H3205>beareth<s%> shall <S%H6965>succeed<s%> in the <S%H8034>name<s%> of his <S%H251>brother<s%> which is <S%H4191>dead<s%>, that his <S%H8034>name<s%> be not put <S%H4229>out<s%> of <S%H3478>Israel<s%>.

And if the <S%H376>man<s%> <S%H2654>like<s%> not to <S%H3947>take<s%> his brother's <S%H2994>wife<s%>, then let his brother's <S%H2994>wife<s%> go <S%H5927>up<s%> to the <S%H8179>gate<s%> unto the <S%H2205>elders<s%>, and <S%H559>say<s%>, My husband's <S%H2993>brother<s%> <S%H3985>refuseth<s%> to raise <S%H6965>up<s%> unto his <S%H251>brother<s%> a <S%H8034>name<s%> in <S%H3478>Israel<s%>, he <S%H14>will<s%> not perform the duty of my husband's <S%H2992>brother<s%>.

Then the <S%H2205>elders<s%> of his <S%H5892>city<s%> shall <S%H7121>call<s%> him, and <S%H1696>speak<s%> unto him: and if he <S%H5975>stand<s%> to it, and <S%H559>say<s%>, I <S%H2654>like<s%> not to <S%H3947>take<s%> her;

Then shall his brother's <S%H2994>wife<s%> <S%H5066>come<s%> unto him in the <S%H5869>presence<s%> of the <S%H2205>elders<s%>, and <S%H2502>loose<s%> his <S%H5275>shoe<s%> from off his <S%H7272>foot<s%>, and <S%H3417>spit<s%> in his <S%H6440>face<s%>, and shall <S%H6030>answer<s%> and <S%H559>say<s%>, So shall it be <S%H6213>done<s%> unto that <S%H376>man<s%> that will not build <S%H1129>up<s%> his <S%H251>brother's<s%> <S%H1004>house<s%>.
And his <S%H8034>name<s%> shall be <S%H7121>called<s%> in <S%H3478>Israel<s%>, The <S%H1004>house<s%> of him that hath his <S%H5275>shoe<s%> <S%H2502>loosed<s%>.

¶ When <S%H582>men<s%> <S%H5327>strive<s%> <S%H3162>together<s%> one with <S%H251%H376>another<s%>, and the <S%H802>wife<s%> of the <S%H259>one<s%> draweth <S%H7126>near<s%> for to <S%H5337>deliver<s%> her <S%H376>husband<s%> out of the <S%H3027>hand<s%> of him that <S%H5221>smiteth<s%> him, and putteth <S%H7971>forth<s%> her <S%H3027>hand<s%>, and <S%H2388>taketh<s%> him by the <S%H4016>secrets<s%>:
Then thou shalt cut <S%H7112>off<s%> her <S%H3709>hand<s%>, thine <S%H5869>eye<s%> shall not <S%H2347>pity<s%> her.
¶ Thou shalt not have in thy <S%H3599>bag<s%> divers <S%H68%H68>weights<s%>, a <S%H1419>great<s%> and a <S%H6996>small<s%>.
Thou shalt not have in thine <S%H1004>house<s%> divers <S%H374%H374>measures<s%>, a <S%H1419>great<s%> and a <S%H6996>small<s%>.

But thou shalt have a <S%H8003>perfect<s%> and <S%H6664>just<s%> <S%H68>weight<s%>, a <S%H8003>perfect<s%> and <S%H6664>just<s%> <S%H374>measure<s%> shalt thou have: that thy <S%H3117>days<s%> may be <S%H748>lengthened<s%> in the <S%H127>land<s%> which the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H5414>giveth<s%> thee.
For all that <S%H6213>do<s%> such <S%H428>things<s%>, and all that <S%H6213>do<s%> <S%H5766>unrighteously<s%>, are an <S%H8441>abomination<s%> unto the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%>.
¶ <S%H2142>Remember<s%> what <S%H6002>Amalek<s%> <S%H6213>did<s%> unto thee by the <S%H1870>way<s%>, when ye were come <S%H3318>forth<s%> out of <S%H4714>Egypt<s%>;

How he <S%H7136>met<s%> thee by the <S%H1870>way<s%>, and smote the <S%H2179>hindmost<s%> of thee, even all that were <S%H2826>feeble<s%> <S%H310>behind<s%> thee, when thou wast <S%H5889>faint<s%> and <S%H3023>weary<s%>; and he <S%H3373>feared<s%> not <S%H430>God<s%>.

Therefore it shall be, when the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%> hath given thee <S%H5117>rest<s%> from all thine <S%H341>enemies<s%> round <S%H5439>about<s%>, in the <S%H776>land<s%> which the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H5414>giveth<s%> thee for an <S%H5159>inheritance<s%> to <S%H3423>possess<s%> it, that thou shalt blot <S%H4229>out<s%> the <S%H2143>remembrance<s%> of <S%H6002>Amalek<s%> from under <S%H8064>heaven<s%>; thou shalt not <S%H7911>forget<s%> it.
